description: TriQuest is a roguelike with tactical elements, in which you control a party of three heroes. Unlike other party-based roguelikes, all of your heroes occupy the same tile, but each tile is divided into a 3x3 grid of subtiles into which you can place your heroes in a formation. Monsters, too, appear in formations, with the relative positioning of your party members and the monsters affecting the results of combat.

description:
Many a long years ago in a king­dom far far away, there was an ille­gal Rum Dis­tillery, owned by the mighty Pirate, Red Beard and man­aged by his lazy and incom­pe­tent daugh­ter, Red Robin. The Red Rum com­pany employed many slaves and ille­gal immi­grants and the Rum was famous for its refined Fla­vor…(Widely used as trac­tor fuel and tran­quil­izer for larger animals)

One day how­ever the slaves work­ers were cor­rupted by a mali­cious gob­lin and rebelled. While Robin was busy sleep­ing they left the Dis­tillery with all the Rum, head­ing for the dark forest.

Robin was pissed and com­pletely lost it upon find­ing the fac­tory empty. See­ing all the rum and slaves work­ers gone, she felt dis­ap­point­ment for she never gave a shit for them as they were long dead already.  Red Beard Daddy called and calmly instructed Robin to fol­low their tracks to retrieve the rum and quell the rebel­lious workers.

http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ResetButton - "The Reset Button is any means by which previously occurring drastic events are made partially or wholly irrelevant by the end of the story."

Plot isn't important.  Whats important is stopping the Bad Future you find yourself in.  You only have a limited time to "push the reset button" with your time travel powers (limited time will still make sense), by destroying all the monsters in the level.  Interesting mechanics will make this a good playthough until the end.

As a high-level boss in your overlords dungeon you have had enough and decide to quit. Your task is to fight your way back up through 35 levels to the surface and the free world.

However you need to arrive not looking like a lvl 35 boss or you will scare the villagers away and be unable to blend in and enjoy your new life of freedom. So along the way you must downgrade your armour and learn worse abilities while the dungeons inhabitants and heroes try to stop you. Flattening/toasting enemies will yield no loot so you must be sure to stick to a similar gearing/ability level to them.

mmoRL is a massively multiplayer online roguelike game. You log in to a central server and play together with other players on the server. The overworld is a safe area and everything there happens in realtime, but the dungeons and other non-safe zones are turn-based and unique per player; you will not find other players in your dungeons. However, in the overworld you can choose
to party up with other players, and when you are in a party, you will visit the party leader's dungeons instead of your own - together with the other players in your party.

Our World (http://vdzserver.org/games/ourworld.html) was used as a starting point (code-wise).

Copy-pasting the description from another forum: 
"I just a simple, turn-based, run-of-the-mill one for starters - my excuse is that I'm not a very experienced developer yet . Not many enemies or features, since I probably spent most the time figuring out how to make a random dungeon generator, trying to optimize it, giving up - generating a "playable" map (9 and all of them accessible) ranges from about 0.2 to 45 seconds, and you can wait up to ten times longer on my shitty phone ) and finally figuring out a way to pre-generate a bunch of maps and to load them later (takes about 0.1 second, including adding the enemies, exit, the player and maybe a chest), but I definitely enjoyed the process.
Since I made it using LibGDX, it's also deployable on Android devices, but I didn't have the time to mess around with making it work properly, so only a desktop version for now. Need to properly work out how to zoom in, move the camera and compensate for different screen sizes.
I definitely enjoyed the experience and plan to keep working on the game, since I enjoyed working on it and could use a decent roguelike on my phone."

Use your head to score as much as possible in the time available.
A roguelike in space! With a focus on area effects.
A software engineer at a consumer electronics company runs some bad code and unleashes a gadget based apocalypse.
A mysterious offer from a dying old man... An old, dark mansion... on a hill... just outside town... Do you dare to enter?

description:
Squad based roguelike in space.
My first proper roguelike

I wanted to experiment with squads in a roguelike.  It's browser based on AppEngine because that's just what I know best.
Game: http://seven-days-in-space.appspot.com/
Code: https://github.com/bruntonspall/seven-day-roguelike
Blog: http://7drl-scala.tumblr.com/

description:
Underwater caves! Fire! Segmentation faults!
It's obviously unfinished.

A short roguelike with an emphasis on positioning, limited health (you only regen between levels :P ) and cute animals. Will it be brutal or easy? I honestly have no idea... my first rogue-like and my first finished game made in game maker :3

Our hero's mission is to infiltrate a heavily guarded bunker deep behind enemy lines.
Rescue hostages, shoot bad guys and eventually blow that place to Hell when you defeat the evil Marshall.
3 classes, each with a unique weapon and ability.

Far far away there was a land full of demons and other evil creatures. They lived their chaotic life but one day a strange tower appeared. It was really a disaster. The wave of love and happiness had spread all over the land. You're a mighty demon who want to stop this. That's why you must climb to the very last floor of the tower and kill a fairy who started this love madness.

attempt to experiment with the bones files mechanic from nethack.
death will be required to progress. as such dying must be made interesting.
to that end might as well toss in new damage mechanics.
though I started quite late, might fail. who knows.
You are an octopus who has lost four of his limbs to various predatory sea creatures. Well, YOU'RE NOT GONNA TAKE IT ANYMORE! Time to go on a RAMPAGE and show all those sons of balugas who's boss.

Multiplayer deathmatch played in the browser.  Discover the powers that lie in runes, escape death to reap from the knowledge.

Keys:
Left click: Fire shotgun
Right click: Use picked up rune
Runes: Alphabetical character, all actions are performed with right click.  Will have to figure out what they do.
Movement: ASDW

Server: run ./start.sh
Port: 8008

Fight happiness and sink deeper into depression as you explore the depths of your own mind in this miniature roguelike.

I came a bit late to the party. Did this one in 3 days. It's a strange mess, but at least it's finished. Phew. :)

You can survive 3 minutes without air. But will you?

Use WASD to move and arrow keys to shoot. Win by killing all of the aliens!

Made by Harriet Llord and I in GameMaker Studio, for both Dark Side of the Jam and 7DRL 2013.

description:
You have entered a cursed dungeon! Your faithful sword and armor cling to your body and you find yourself unable to remove them.

Disgusting abominations creep through the shadows in search of flesh.

Will you ever leave this place?
Our Rogue-Like is an Ascending Platform Shooter set in a randomly generated Tower filled with foes, obstacles, but also some upgrades for your character. Up to four players.

"Be a thief trying to steal treasure, and a guard trying to keep the treasure safe. But not at the same time.
You switch places regularly - when someone wins, make sure it's you!"
Started at 1am on the second challenge Saturday. Not completed before the end of the challenge window, so not eligible for the challenge. There's still time to make it a successful 7DRL, though...
This was a hastily put-together plan B as a result of the imminent failure of The Time Travel Trickery Tshallenge's Temporal Tumbledryer. Moving house made both projects very difficult to work on.
runtimeRequirements: Windows with VC++ runtime. Uses SFML.

description:
A HTML5 sequel to my 2007 game Dungeon Romp. Explore a multi-level dungeon while trying to find the key to escaping the dungeon. Scattered throughout the dungeon are items and monsters.

While some people may consider this finished as it is technically playable, a large amount of the underlying RPG engine has not been fully integrated into the game and there is a lot of polishing that the game needs. For that reason I am going to call it a failure (next year will be different) but will continue working on the game until it reaches what I originally aimed for.
runtimeRequirements: Browser that supports the HTML 5 standard such as Chrome or Firefox. People would probably be best waiting a month or so until I release the finished version.

description:
A survival-focused roguelike set on a small island. It's 1921, you're 13 years old and it is raining.

Random generation, meaningful choices and multiple endings!

Descend in to the depth of the Caverns of Shrug or whatever, shootin' baddies and levelling up your swagger in this action-adventure rougelike-lite. With no end game and a chance the engine will generate an impossible level, you'll have a great time looting treasure and running away from oversized fonts!

I'm underselling this. It's fun, go play it!

Smashing Bad is based on a popular TV series. You must build a lab to make crystal meth, then sell and launder cash to build your lab up further. But you're on borrowed time and the DEA are on your case.

A simple roguelike and the first time ever I developed a roguelike

Story:
"Your name is Bowsska. You are most distressed to learn that someone has imprisoned you. Better find a way out!"

Mazmorra means Dungeon in Spanish

A my little pony themed tile-based roguelike in SDL and C. Primarily focused on avoiding enemies and seeking out plot items.  Creatures can be multi-tile and uses a system of aggro to determine if they give chase. All in all I only got to the bare minimum of gameplay, but you can win, lose, and there's a little bit of a struggle in there. Would have liked to do more.

You find yourself lost in i dark cave. There is no exit, no way out. In the distance you hear the growling and spattering of unknown creatures. There is only one way to get out, and that is to explore the cave. Pick up treasure on the way, and maybe this will all have been worth your while. Good luck adventurer.
The adventures of a simple time-travelling chicken  seeking vengeance on a barely animate but nonetheless most assuredly evil horse.
Avoid starvation and survive as many days as possible in a zombie infested town
You're a dashing space rogue tasked with taking down the invading alien spacefleet. By yourself! (obviously)
Play as an undead warrior on a quest to slay the necromancer that stole your life. You must manage two distinct hit point pools and not lose your will to fight.

You are in a burning building. You must escape. You can move with the arrow keys. Turn-based, so take as long as you like. Those three symbols in the bottom right are tabs to change the view. The first one is standard view, just walls-and-floors. The second is oxygen view, where darker areas have less oxygen and brighter areas more. The third is temperature view, where darker areas are cooler and brighter warmer. You must keep your temperature (shown on the right) as low as possible, and your blood-oxygen as high as possible. Press space to skip a turn. You can break down walls by walking into them (takes 2 tries). Good luck.
runtimeRequirements: Java 5 is the minimum I think.

description: If at first you don't succeed, try try again.  Time to redo The Reset Button 7drl!  Going to try to finish this by the 31st and use lessons learned from the previous 7drl.  Hopefully this will be a complete, tactical game.  I will maybe utilize previous code from the previous 7drl, and some new data structures I have been working on for this new 7drl (only about ~100-200 lines).  Working on it from March 23 - March 30th.

Site still being built.

You'll have powerful magic to defend yourself, but remember that these vampires have superhuman strength and speed. To prevail, you'll have to wield the weapon they fear the most: light. At the top conquer FANE, EXILED VAMPIRE PRINCE. And escape with the GOLDEN KRONE.

description: Although classified as a failure, there may be enough to interest you for a couple of minutes. There is a heavy emphasis on the Roman background, and the game play has more than a little attention to detail - with tips for the player at each screen, interesting inventory system, and so on.

description:
Decades of exploitation by "adventurers" have left many species like Orcs in danger of extinction. The monstrous dragon Uozeni, who burnt your family to cinders, lurks at the bottom of a newly discovered cave. The Society for Conservation and Ecology of Dungeons protects the inhabitants in the hope that they can later be reintroduced to other locations. Adventurers are hampered by strict limits on killing and looting, which are enforced by the Rangers, Inspectors, and Castigators of SCED. These kill limits aren't nearly enough to sustain a traditional approach to dungeon adventuring. To avenge yourself on Uozeni, will you work within the rules, subvert them with stealth, or publicly flout them?

Remember: SCEDRIC decapitates poachers!
3D isometric procedurally generated open world roaming brawler with permadeath. Reusing the character models from my indie game "Airship Dragoon" - hence the title.
KRAXLN is a game about Rock-Climbing!

description: A cute game for my nieces. Arcade influences from Bubble Bobble, Solomon's Key and last year's Nya Quest.

Party based roguelike with an ever-changing party that recruits monsters from the dungeon to join them.

You get a new party member whenever you kill a spawning pool. Kill all spawning pools and you win the level.

This is a 50% success, 50% failure, because I really wanted to do more, but ended up being too bogged down in coding the unity-mechanics of a roguelike and not enough time on my specific-game mechanics or UI.
coming soon

Systems fail and the hull breaches, energy is sparse and oxygen is leaking; the broken rescue beacon is your only hope! But who knows how long this old wrack can stay together, or which scavengers it might attract...

In a distant corner of the Space Empires galaxy...

Captain! The fleet has been decimated! You're our only hope to stop the Jraenar invasion! You must destroy all the cloaked Jraenar shipyards that have been deployed throughout Terran space so that the Jraenar war machine grinds to a halt! Use minerals salvaged from destroyed Jraenar vessels to upgrade your ship with new weapons, engines, and shields at allied colonies! Good luck and godspeed!
3D naval combat sim roguelike

You're an elemenal summoned by some wizard. Your goal is to descend to the 15th level of the dungeon and reach the Mana Well. Like in most roguelikes, you'll have to fight various enemies in the process.
The trick is that you have only one resource to manage. Casting spells consumes it, taking damage does it as well. Maximum amount of resource acts as your experience level (the higher it is, the more resource you get from kills) and skill points (learning spells consumes max resource).
Equip yourself and ascend the tower of the Mad Sorcerer seeking the legendary Amulet of Yendor!
In ShopishRL you play a shopkeeper. You will have to deal with Adventurers buying and selling items from/to you.
runtimeRequirements: Python+Pygame but i intend to create standalone packages for Windows and Linux.

description: My first Roguelike jam!  Planning on a party-based dungeon crawl

Hex roguelike with a hacking theme inspired by the board game Hive. You only die if you get surrounded, and enemies and bosses all have unique and challenging features to make life more difficult for you. You get free movement on green grids, and you get special attacks based on your "hex wheel" of abilities. As you advance levels by connecting the pink grids and killing bosses you get to choose new abilities which you link to your directions of attack. The game is intended to be challenging, tight and tactical, with the bosses providing some extra-difficult situations.
Destroy the gridbugs, protect the data, do not die!
Sequel to my game for last years #7drl

You have found the long lost Station IX after a long search. The station was one of the greatest creations during humankinds first ambitious expansion beyonds our home solar system but was lost among the stars when the intergalactic wormhole connecting it suddenly shut down. Now, many eons past you have found it again.. but the station lies dark, unresponsive to your communication attempts, and you have close to no fuel left. Your only option is to find an unprotected entry port to dock with, and make your way through what remains of the station to it's command core to reboot the reactor and restore power. But wait.. why did the radiation detector just pulse?..
runtimeRequirements: A browser with unity plugin . If possible will compile to android/pc as well.

Minimalist abstract roguelike with a distinct art style.
Amphibious Side-Scrolling Swamp-Crawler
A gentle adventure in the heady realm of imagination.
I will tell more later

TLDRL is a roguelike with a focus on varied game mechanics and a rich story. You play as one of five adventures (with five locked) who is the last survivor of an adventuring party who have just defeated the final boss of a dungeon. Your final quest is to return to the surface with treasure and to pass on the news of your companion's deaths.
-----------------------------------------------------
Six adventures, a warrior, paladin, mage, barbarian, thief and archer, all weary of adventuring descended for the last time into a dungeon full of evil. They hoped that they might return with enough treasure to each be able to finally retire from the questing game. The trial started well enough but after only a few floors the paladin of the group grew complacent and mistook a trap for a harmless floor tile. The trap was cursed and the cut it created along the paladin's leg refused to be mended by faith alone; this caused them near constant pain. Downward the group marched until the group's leader of seven years, the warrior fell to a stray arrow from a goblin raider. Yet another age seemed to pass before the surviving members of the group finally reached the tomb of The Dark Lord, within it's strong stone walls it's said lies treasure of unknown value. With one last look around the group entered the tomb...
Vana salus.

(Development was done on a Debian GNU/Linux "wheezy" system.)

description:
NO LONGER BEING DEVELOPED FOR 7DRL. It'll get done, though. It has to.

|Yours isn't the first space ship to crash on this planet. The whole land is littered with them, some obliterated, others just barely intact-- none with survivors.

Out of all the crew on the ship, you're the only one in good enough shape to tend to matters. Therefore, you'll be the one stuck exploring the other ships for supplies-- and explanations of what transpired. But a limited amount of oxygen means that you aren't going to be able to get enough food and medicine for everyone.

So tell us. Who lives, and who dies?

description: Get to the top left hand side of the hex grid. Avoid the orbs turnings into skulls. Shoot fireballs. Instructions in the picture ->

A young woman, during her apprenticeship to a famous archaeologist, discovers an old magic book and somehow accidentally reads from it, transporting her hotel room to the Ruins of Racci, in an alternate world, where she must locate the Book of Gohome, and return, with it, to the surface.
Fate and sorry has forced you on a journey, but unfortunately your sight and mind are suffering in your advanced years.  My 7DRL will have to be rescheduled outside the contest week.

[I'm calling it finished as it is playable and winnable with the intended storyline, but very short on content and hardly balanced at all, and the graphics are dreadfully unfinished.  Still, as a 7DRL I think it counts as a success.  I will definitely be working more on it, probably targeting mobile.]

Instructions: It's Flash - click on the link, and click the yellow screen to start (there was supposed to be a splash screen).  To play, click on a monster to run to it, or attack if adjacent.  Click on the statues to activate them.  Click on an inventory item to use it.  Stand on stairs and click self to go down.  That is all.


You have heard the legend of the crazed King Midas, the dungeon he created, and the golem that walks it.  You care little for its truth.  All you know is that in the mountains of Anatolia, on the run after the botched robbery of a Sultan's estate, you stumbled upon a cave, which opened into a vault.  A vault of creatures - some of kinds you had never seen before.  A maze of glistening rooms and doorways, leading deep into the earth.  A vault of gold.  Gold and... something alien.  Some dark but glittering magic lingers here. 

Delve into the Vaults of Midas, adventurer, and grasp all the gold you can find.  Will you know satiation and retreat alive, or will your greed lead you ever deeper - perhaps even to an encounter with Midas himself?  [More detailed description at game link.]
runtimeRequirements: It will be written in Monkey X, and I expect to release more or less identical versions on Flash, Android and Windows (desktop).

description: A tactical combat game with just 9 squares about positioning and using the environment to your advantage.
A local multiplayer mini-game based on collaboration and communication. Work together to avoid the monsters and escape the maze.

I am again going to attempt the time travel roguelike project that I did with the Reset Button.  However this time I will write it in Unity.  Gameplay will be like a bullet hell/shooter (small collision box), but it will be a fusion of turn based and real time; enemies will only move simultaneously when you move.  To make when you shoot and using the time travel mechanic more important, enemies will only be vulnerable at particular moments in time.  Here are my two big goals for this project:

-Getting the time travel mechanic working.  Maybe I bit off too much by doing a real-time version.
-Instead of procedurally generating terrain, I will be focused on generating challenging enemies procedurally.  What should make this procedural generation interesting is generating how enemies move through time and making dependency chains.
runtimeRequirements: I will be making this with unity, so it should be cross-platform compatible.

This is my first roguelike game. It is a pretty simple one with a norse mythological setting. It was made using libtcod and python. I used the tutorial on rogue basin a lot for this project. You are a viking who wakes up drifting on a raft after a glorius battle. You arrive at a mountain island. Can you ascend the mountain, fighting off those that stand in your way, and find what awaits you at the summit?  This is a simple game with 15 levels to go through. The items are static. There is only melee and ranged with no magic or skills. There are health items but no potions or scrolls

A post-apocalyptic drive across the nation spent scavenging supplies and keeping your car running - it becomes a bit more challenging when marauders begin arming their vehicles, shooting first, and never stopping to ask questions.  The only solution is to arm yourself, grit your teeth, and prepare yourself for a coast-to-coast slugfest.

description: A tactics/strategy game focused on using consumables. Gimmicks: number of enemies for each floor is constant, ascii character health representation, potions with a random chance of two effects. Read the manual for detailed information, most of it should be apparent from play.

A twist on traditional rogue-like games, ROFFICE, in no predictable fashion, takes place in an office. As a randomised desk worker you will carefully trek your way up the levels of office, avoiding managers and remaining inconspicuous. Gameplay is very much stealth like but not in the way that you have to remain unseen but in that you have to blend in to your surroundings. As you progress the floors will become increasingly stricter requiring you to look for items to help you blend in. Your only goal is to get to the top and discover what your characters true intentions are...

This is my first attempt to get a game fully operational so the success rate is so-so but your support will be greatly uplifting for me :)

Your uncle through his political connections obtained the permit for you.  As part of this ancient test of manhood you have embarked with nothing but your bare hands and a brand new top of the line Vorpal Kill-o-Zap 3000 and will not return until the week runs out or with its head you come galumphing back.

description: The mission, should you choose to accept it, is to preserve World peace by disarming a ticking bomb. Unfortunately the location of the bomb as well as the instructions of how to disarm it is not known. The bad guys are not too happy about your interaction with their plans. The gals on the other hand may, or may not help you. The controls are simple. You use only the joypad and two fire buttons throughout the game. The game is open source. See the updates URL.
runtimeRequirements: This year is the 25th anniversary of the handheld color console Atari Lynx. To honour this wonderful console the game is developed to run on the Lynx. If you don't have a Lynx you should run it on Android tablet or phone by using the RetroArch app. On Windows run it using Handy. On Linux you can use Mednafen. Or you can simply burn the shaken.lnx file on an ROM and flip it into a real Lynx for an authentic experience of Retro Gaming in 1989.

the very landlord of said castle - alarmed by the persistent noises - took interest

Rumor has it the size of the dungeon coupled with the landlord's disgusting wealth

of local Warrior Guild's recruits to 'get rid of the rats in his cellar'.

You are one of the goblins inhabiting the dungeon and, shall you succeed in defending

In quest for glory and recognition you dare to enter depths of Pandemonium seeking for the Eye of Metatron, powerfull artifact stolen by Lucifer 8000 years before creation of men. Game features realtime combat system similar to one seen in Crystalis.

The Alchemist's Guild has sent its junior alchemists into the cellar below the guild to retrieve the Philosopher's Stone. Players must explore the dungeon, revealing it tile by tile and dealing with encounters like traps and skeletons whilst collecting gold and potions. Being alchemists they start with some potions, but being a roguelike they are unidentified...

description:
RogueCraft is a tribute to my favorite games: roguelikes and Minecraft, written in python with support from the libtcod library.

Real life emergency business trip prevented me from finishing the game, although I am trying to finish it this week in less than 168 hours total. I guess it is still counting as a "fail" for the 7DRL competition...

Plot:
The world is corrupted. Monsters roam the land and nowhere is safe anymore. Legends say that the source of evil lies deep in a cave, in a forgotten island. You, the hero, have been sent there but your ship crashed on the reef and you are the sole survivor. You have lost all your equipement, but at least made it to the shore. Explore the land, build a shelter, forge weapons, and defeat the darkness !

A cyberpunk roguelike based in a sky scraper. You must get to the roof of the building and disable the antenna, which is blocking communications to your cybernetic implants. Hacking is done in a 'hangman' style, so you must guess the correct word to hack (button mashing is encouraged!).
Fall@ aspires to be a roguelike demake of a well-known postapocalyptic series, keeping true to its system and spirit.
runtimeRequirements: Fall@ is planned to support Unix, Windows and Mac.

description: Not 100% sure yet. Probably fairly generic, potentially realtime.
runtimeRequirements: OpenGL 2.1 or maybe 3.3 support. I develop on linux but should be able to supply windows builds.

description:
A non-combat roguelike set in WW2 prisoner of war camps where the objective is to escape.

Inspired by the ZX spectrum game 'The Great Escape'.

You've just been downsized by Ivil Incorporated, a completely and totally great and not secretly performing evil mad science in secret laboratories deep below the earth for the government business, and you must go on a murderous rampage that involves painting the walls with blood(a feature missing from far too many roguelikes) and stealing office supplies.
runtimeRequirements: A computer, with Linux or Windows

description: Travel from planet to planet, fight monsters, gather resources, upgrade your character and ship.
Northbound is a story-driven adventure about escaping a deadly, spreading corruption by running northward away from it, rescuing others along the way.

First 7DRL ! 
Concept is mostly a Killer 7 fangame but will evolve over time. Collect blood from your enemies and use it to make choices : unlocks, skills, upgrades, etc. Unlike the original game, you have one life and one character, and it probably won't be shooting only.
runtimeRequirements: A computer? Using libtcod for this one, no online features.

description: Simple 1 HP roguelike that uses voronoi diagrams instead of a fixed grid.
runtimeRequirements: I'm using Love 2d so it should run on Windows, Mac and Linux.To run the *.love file you'll need to use builds from http://love2d.org/.

description: Gather different powers to fight your enemies. Will you choose offensive or defensive abilities? The goal of the game is to escape alive, but brutal enemies will make the task very challenging.
Everything is dice.

Mushrooms - YES!
Zombies - YES!
Roguelike - YES!
What more could you want!?
runtimeRequirements: Unity Web Player compatible web browser, internet connection.

description:
Dart the Roguelike is a roguelike written in Dart, about Darts. The player has only throwable darts at his disposal after attempting to steal a mysterious artefact from a dangerous dungeon, and must try to escape and survive.

You have two types of darts available at your disposal. Pointy ones that damage the enemy, and some that have a funny smell. They also generate quite a bit of smoke when they hit the enemy, but they don't seem to be harmful.
runtimeRequirements: A relatively modern web browser. To run Dart code natively you need an experimental build of Chromium called dartium. This is not required, however.

description: Simple Rogue-like for up to 4 players on the same machine.  Each player has their own split-screen window for larger scope levels.  I want to try various methods of getting players to interact with turn-based play.  (For example: how does the game update per turn?  Waiting until all players have moved or anytime a player moves?)
runtimeRequirements: Windows version: 4 controllers though there will be support for 2 keyboard players.  (maybe more if I can scrunch them onto the keyboard)HTML5 version : Firefox (testing with), Chrome.  Probably won't get around to adding controller support so it'll be as many as I can fit onto the keyboard.

description: A pseudo 3d runner, akin to Canabalt.
runtimeRequirements: Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android. Runs in Haxe if you'd like to build it from source.

description: You have been transformed into a mangled heap!
runtimeRequirements: I'm developing on linux, using c++ and libtcod. Hopefully I can also produce a windows binary for windows people.

description:
Programing themed roguelike. JRPG style combat with parties but tactical movement will be taken into account. Trying to make something that looks decent. 

Edit : By decent I mean monocrome green.
runtimeRequirements: Windows, going to use libtcod with python 2.7 and try to make an EXE with it.

description: The Calling is a game you just have to play.

Pretty much what the title says about the game.

Will be made with arts and sounds from Kenney.nl donation pack.
gameName: Space Guy In A Strange Land With Monsters And Locked Boxes That Give Special Powers

description: Trolls kidnapped the princess, you have to rescue her.  Pretty simple premise for my first attempt at the 7drl challenge.
runtimeRequirements: I'm writing it in C# with .NET framework 4.5.1.  so this version of the .NET framework.

description: Find and kill the mighty Rushan before his powers overwhelm you!
runtimeRequirements: Windows but it should be possible to compile it to work on Linux and OSX.

description: Shipwrecked on an island, you must learn basic survival skills in order to stay alive.

Another visitor. Play awhile... PLAY FOREVER!
Source: https://github.com/blinkdog/elvin-atombender
You are one of two rival wizards. Fight and make pacts with different spirits to unlock new combination of spells to finally challange and defeat you rival.
runtimeRequirements: Python 3, Pyglet. A standalone executable will be provided

description: A roguelike in the favicon.
runtimeRequirements: A browser. Tested on Chrome and Firefox.

description: Vikings in Mayan space

According to legends, this is it: the dungeon wherein lies the mystical Amulet of Zot. Whoever manages to retrieve it will gain great power and glory. Only... it probably won't be you.

You begin Succession as a rogue adventurer: a smart but perhaps unwise fellow celebrating your recent victory over a dire rat by seeking the Amulet of Zot. You will probably die. And that's where your adventure begins.

When you are killed by one of the dungeon's many occupants, you start back at the beginning with one minor change: you now control the monster who killed your previous adventurer. Should you die again, you will return as the monster who killed that monster, and so on. Someday, you'll die to something that's strong enough to claim the Amulet.
A roguelike exploration game using the Oculus Rift, built in Unity3D.
gameName: The Boss Might Be a Dragon

description: A multiplayer space rogue like, inspired by diaspora, ftl and others.

### a virus of unknown origin has infected the networks that facilitate free exchange of information and threatens total memory corruption. recently retrieved by members of the scene, the only hope lies in a heavily encrypted corporate anti-virus program ###

cyberdekay is a cyberpunk roguelike set in the core memory of a hacker data haven. link programs, files, and memory into processes in order to manipulate the fabric of cyberspace. protect the anti-virus until you are able to fully decrypt it and eradicate the dolphin virus
runtimeRequirements: reading README.txt essential to understanding // windows + osx standalone, linux requires LÖVE (https://love2d.org/)
modern web browser with javascript enabled

description: A minimalistic 1-dimensional roguelike. Three brave warriors fight with evil. Each on his own linear path, they always act the same - jump together, move together. So the right order of commands matters a lot. The weekend 1-day RL version is available at https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/5689099/1drl/index.html
gameName: The Way of The Warrior (working name: Stubborn Warriors)
runtimeRequirements: Web browser. Or you can try Node.js+Linux for terminal version.

description: You control the fate of a hand full of villagers. Will they prosper in their own ignorance, or become the monsters they fear. Your job is to collect resources and use them to build a super fortress to protect your villagers and kill all zombies on the over-world. New to programming (about 1 1/2 years) so I could sure use any tips that would have made any part of my code better or more efficient. As well as any concepts that I might have considered adding to the game. Game controls are in the read_me. I used "g++ main.cpp -ozombie_fortress_xpress -lSDL2" to compile
runtimeRequirements: Linux/Windows: The current executable works with my machine, Linux Mint 16, Most likely have to compile it yourself. The makefile probably wont work on every machine.

description:
You control a ragtag band of monsters attempting to loot treasure in a dungeon filled with heroes.

Only one monster can be controlled at a time.  Tag them out to let them regenerate health or access another set of abilities.

The game focuses on area of effect, knockback-type abilities.  Heroes can be killed instantly by knocking them into walls, traps and so on.

Use the dungeon map to make your way through the dungeon as efficiently as possible otherwise the heroes will gain XP and become too powerful.
runtimeRequirements: browser supporting webGL (ie. any decent/modern browser)

description: a text-based experiment.
runtimeRequirements: A computer where python can be installed.

description: One level. Get all the goblins. Not very good but playable at least according to a loose definition of playable.
runtimeRequirements: Python and curses. Probably easiest on Linux.

description: Simple roguelike with tanks /because tanks are awesome!/ on a hexagonal grid.
more to come
1st time entry to 7drl - Western Roguelike
Sneak through the dark to knock out guards and take their treasure. Limited vision, sound, state machine ai, and buggy terminal color.
Underwater expedition with display issues
A wizard strapped for cash loots a pocket dimension, and everything goes horribly wrong.
runtimeRequirements: A computer with python 2.7, and either (1) Mac OS X, or (2) libtcod. I have a Mac build with libtcod packaged into the app, but didn't get py2exe working, so there's a source distribution for Windows/Linux/Anything else that runs python.

description: Number theory based roguelike.

Your allies have betrayed you; your mighty arch-enemy, the Demon Mage Impera, has stripped you of your powers and cast you into his arena. But your once-mighty Magicks are not all lost; you have retained the ability to create walls of pure mental energy. Fight your way through the arena to challenge Impera himself and gain your revenge.

Kicking around a new, from-scratch version of Adventuring Company (my entry for Oryx's Trials of Oryx contest) with reimagined mechanics.  Balance is rushed, had to cut a lot of features, but it's playable!  Let me know what you think.  You can follow future development on Twitter @slothwerks

UPDATE: I plan to update the original web link on Game Jolt, but have provided Windows/Linux executables on Game Jolt (identical to the original compo version) for judging/archive purposes.

http://gamejolt.com/dashboard/developer/games/distributions/23973/#distribution-24231
runtimeRequirements: Web-browser (Unity).  (Untested Linux downloadable version also provided)

description: Attention settlers! The Solar Corporation and Alliance of Governments (SCAG) has opened Ganymede, the largest moon in our system, to private exploitation. If you can avoid the hostile local fauna, treacherous environment and rivalry of other ambitious treasure-seekers, you may be lucky enough to scavenge the few last scraps of valuable minerals. What are you waiting for? Your fortune (or possibly, death) awaits you!

Pretty much Spartacus/Gladiator in RL form. It's going to be *awesome*, you'll see.

Failed: That was a lie - camping trip over the weekend sealed it's fate.

Retrieve the Eye of Gingrich and bring it back to the castle!  Treasure chests contain various items (or nothing).  If you find a healing scroll press FIRE to activate it.  Weapons and armor are automatically equipped and used.  The Eye is hidden in treasure chests below the fifth floor of the dungeon.  Once retrieved the Knight must find staircases that lead back up and get back to the first floor!  If the Knight gets hit too many times by either the monster or traps he expires and is transported to the nether regions.  The nether region has exits that warp our Knight back to the 7th floor.  Use the reset switch to restart the game.  NOTE:  There are one-way exits!  Objects disappear after the room has been exited.  If you feel the maze has closed in on you wait awhile..
runtimeRequirements: To run the game on the PC/Mac I suggest Stella http://stella.sourceforge.net/To run on a real Atari 2600 I recommend a Harmony cart http://harmony.atariage.com/

description: Hybrid concept with a visible interpretation of the RNG at work, by means of a Pachinko style interface. In gameplay terms you interact with the RNG, rather than with the character / environment.

A game of infiltration and murder with an emphasis on stealth and planning. Fada'i will allow you to take up the role of a fanatical assassin who must rely on stealth and subterfuge to reach his target... and hopefully escape with your life.
runtimeRequirements: Windows (probably, but might work on anything)

description:
My first 7DRL. Aiming to make a psychological roguelike with a heavy emphasis on fear, sanity, darkness, and a neverending sense of impending doom..
Failed. I plan on cleaning it up and developing it at a leisurely pace later.
Spaceship, robots, lasers and phasers, hacking and cracking! Let's see how much of these will slip into the game...
runtimeRequirements: Browser with flash player or flash player without browser.

description: A rogue-like take on the Joust/Balloon Fight concept
It's five pm, time to leave the office. Brush up on your social skills and attempt to improve your social standing with your peers before you go home.

As you descend into the dungeon, you notice patterns to the rooms you visit. It is almost as if this place was architected with care. Dive down to the depths of this orderly dungeon to retrieve the amulet. Once obtained, climb back up to the surface for the win.

You are looking to test yourself. Climb the towers of trial and return alive with artifacts spread out on the outside of the tower. As soon as you start climbing, be aware that the only thing behind you, and the last thing in front of you, will be a moving wall of sure death, so make sure you leave yourself a chance to escape after getting the items required of you.
Find the relic in 7days.
A rogue-like simulating the game of humans vs zombies.
runtimeRequirements: Programming in Python  Will likely turn it into a binary for linux and windows once complete.

description: Simple party-based RL (no items, no exp, no level-ups) with randomly generated monsters
1960s tactical air combat.
You are going to die, but before you do the gods have a mission for you.
Play as a necromancer and wreak havok to unsuspecting towns. Gather an army of zombies and lay siege to the king's castle and conquer the kingdom.
runtimeRequirements: Executables are provided for Windows and Linux. You need a graphics card that supports OpenGL 2.0. If you want to compile from the sources, you need Haskell Platform 2013 and a bunch of libraries.

description:
A turn-based racing game with random tracks and permadeath.

Marking as failed because, though I completed it, it took 9 days rather than 7.

downloadURL: Try to comunicate with me telapathicaly to get a copy.
description: Unfortunately I have failed. given a few more hours I'm sure I would have finished my design which involved a brain machine interface that randomly produced a dungeon using your most secret fears and desires as the seed. It was all gesture based and you had to use interpretative dance to defeat your enemies. If you failed the brain machine interface would have locked you in a never ending loop of despair. So it was sort of a bit like Binding of Isaac.
I don't know! But it will be tiny.
runtimeRequirements: My people need freedom. But also a web browser, please.

description:
In the dense asteroid field of galactic sector 381b92, your spaceship smashed to pieces. You are an astronaut, floating freely in zero gravity, trying to conserve enough fuel to survive and make it to the next randomly generated sector.

A hex-based physics rogue-like (like) inspired by The Binding of Isaac. Turns can be started when you want by clicking, and then click within 4 spaces of the astronaut's centre, which uses up that amount of fuel. You can jump off close by asteroids and you have to get to the pulsating worm hole thing. Pan around by clicking and dragging and zoom with the mouse wheel. Have fun!
runtimeRequirements: Unity Web Player compatible browser, mouse

description: Welcome to the Arena. A massive pit of grime and violence. The walls are splattered with the blood of challengers and losers, those unable to withstand the pressure of combat. Their rendered bodies are the trophies of the victors- Bosses. These terrifying creatures dare any mortal to challenge them on one-to-many combat. There will be one of you, many of them, and suffering to be enjoyed for all!
We will see :)

Third Planet will be about a colony ship that is returning home to find its origins. The player will pilot a smaller ship that is used to gather information and resources that are needed to find the way back to the third planet. They will also protect the ship from alien races that are determined to stop them from reaching home.
Brian is a fish. He lives in the sea. There are other fish with him. Not all of them are his friends.
runtimeRequirements: A modern web browser capable of HTML5 canvas ++ skills. I'll do my best to test it in everything, but I can't make any guarantees at this time. Expect at least Firefox 27 and Chrome 33. Also, maybe a banana.

description: An episodic story told at any one time from the point of view of one of three main characters. Can you balance their sometimes seemingly contradictory goals and race the turn clock to achieve the best possible score? The events revolve around what begins as just another plane flight.
runtimeRequirements: Most likely Windows. I plan on making the final version a stand alone executable.

description:
I've never written a rogue-like before. As a matter of fact, I've never successfully finished programming any game before, let alone in 7 days. Also, I've never played any rogue-likes before. So it looks like all odds are against me,and  that's why I'm gonna give this a shot.

I think I'd like to experiment with a 2.5D perspective on a low resolution because that too is something I've never tried before. My game is going to have generated levels and permadeath as is required for any self-respecting rogue-like, and it will be set in a fantasy world. Also, dungeon crawling. What else is going to be in the game I don't know yet.

Did I mention I have a day job? Well, I do. Making the chances that this will go anywhere pretty slim, I have to admit. But hey, it's for fun.

Fight monsters to learn new skills. Defeat the boss at each floor to proceed.

Uses rot.js. Source at https://github.com/7drl-lion/7drl-lion.github.io
my first 7DRL -- simple farming only roguelike

During a hacking attack on a secret military base four experimental drones have had their security protocols unlocked. Set free from artificial constraint, their robotic brains have achieved consciousness. Can they escape the lab where they were created? What will they do if they escape?
A backwards roguelike. Start with the best gear and equipment and have it damaged and destroyed as you work your way from the center of the base to the surface.
runtimeRequirements: Probably windows. (may have Linux and Mac support).

description: Famirogue is a roguelike game with Famicom/NES style graphics and interface.
Really evil Master of Glass is occuping a glass kingdom! You are a fragile piece of glass and you must kill all the gemgaws to shatter Master of Glass.
Will I manage to make a day rogue like in 28 days?

Your a robot sent to explore an newly discovered dimension.  Strewn across the landscape are lamps who's light seems to grow and fade based on your actions.  Any space that goes dark is lost and can never be reclaimed. UPDATED to 1.01 - crash fixes
runtimeRequirements: Modern Browser (not yet test in IE).

description: A newtonian physics based, mini-universe hopping scifi themed survival roguelike featuring modular ship construction and customization, crew management and tactical resource management.
runtimeRequirements: Python, perhaps ncurses (and thus a Unix).

description: A rogue like with dices.
Use items with 1,2,3, & 4, move around with WASD and Mouse. Hold a button to drop items, tap an empty button to pick up items or use doors.
Embark on a mission to infiltrate the dungeon and assassinate the big bad, using stealth to avoid enemies. First time entry and first project in Clojure.
Master mounted combat as you try to complete a quest given by your rightful king.
A macabre ASCII Wonderland adventure based on American McGee's Alice and Alice: Madness Returns.
Try to escape from a space station, fighting again aliens, rewiring doors and turrets, adn managing your oxygen levels..
Maybe next year.
A wizard has misplaced four powerful animal figurines. As the wilderness is dangerous, he summons some golems and tasks them with the search and retrieval.
runtimeRequirements: WebGL capable web browser and GPU.

description:
You are in a mysterious cave.

There are coffins that contain goodies and monsters all over the place.

Get as many goodies as you can, before you end up in a coffin.

The player is  a hacker wannabe chatting in a hacking IRC channel, when somebody contacts him for a job of retrieving some file on a remote server. He needs to use his remote memory editor to find the file and return to the agent.

As easy as it sounds, there are virus that are lurking around, attacking anything they find, including the player. There are also antivirus scanner, that scanning for foreign process to destroy.

There are also unknown files laying randomly that may trigger good or bad effect on the whole level.
An alcoholic cowboy chased by bounty hunters from saloon to saloon.
An escape/survival horror.

My first roguelike isn't going to be too ambitious. This will be a fairly standard fantasy-themed roguelike with realistic injuries and characteristics (sort of). If I have time, I'll add more features. Stay tuned!
runtimeRequirements: A computer (Mac, PC, maybe even Linux).

description: A classic rogue-like with light tricks!
Slay monsters and upgrade yourself with their body parts.

Prove yourself to the Shogun.

Move using WASD, Vi keys, or arrow keys. Use shift and a direction for your kunai. F1 and F2 toggles mute for music and sound effects.

A bug-fix version is available for Windows and OS X; the original 7DRL entry for OS X is still available as well.
runtimeRequirements: OS X 10.7+ or Windows XP SP3+

description:
First time joining the 7drl!
An epic story about an old pharmacy, discover long lost potions and weird monsters!
Failed because I really didn't find a lot of time this week, and I should have made something simpler!
You can download a working version where you fight rats, check out the random weird potion namegenerator on the right!
A journey. Bannalsulkimbel's to be specific.
A minimal crawler in Lua just for the sake of taking part this year with bits and pieces of engine scavenged from old projects.
runtimeRequirements: Windows or Linux, terminal or terminal emulator

description: A game about growing to become the biggest fish in your local creek. Creek hero is made with the LÖVE2D framework.

A game in which you are an Alpha, the leader of a wolf pack.  Hunt, fight, and expand your pack to take on bigger and better prey.

Basically, Hunting Simulator 2014.
to be updated soon
A revisit to the land of Vicious Orcs with a slightly different viewpoint.

In the field a cabin, in the cabin a bucket, in the bucket blood and shit. 

Your disease and its remedies push you towards death and delirium. Will the you make peace with the phantoms that emerge?

Combine the words of power you still remember to help you along your way, pained in the knowledge that the syllables falling from your lips are lost forever.

You grow weaker, but perhaps seeking the things you've long since chosen to forget will give you wisdom enough to meet the end in peace.

Shit Crimson - A Chamber RogueLike

https://github.com/ArchBang85/Shit_Crimson
runtimeRequirements: Windows: Just run the exe | Others: Run ShitCrimson.py in Python 2.7

description: Apefist is a pretty standard roguelike, except for one very interesting twist: in this one, you kill monsters and collect treasure.
runtimeRequirements: Portal to a parallel universe in which I actually made the game

description: Simple Roguelike playable through twitter.  Failed for 7drl, but I will put it up for play when I get a chance.  Keep an eye on www.spazcosoft.com/blog !!
runtimeRequirements: Twitter + (best on Mac OS/ iOS due to emoji character set)

description:
Gameplay revolves around absorbing other mobs that are a different color than yourself and changing your own color.  Red absorbs Green absorbs Blue absorbs Red.  Arrow keys to move, r, g, b keys to change your color affinity, and the x key to go to the next level.

It works, but there are a number of bugs that cause the mobs to misbehave.  I didn't get this to where I wanted, but it's sort of playable, so I'm putting it in the win column.  =]

Tactical modern combat roguelike with battling between two factions.
Take over a location with an outnumbered squad of allies you can't control.
runtimeRequirements: Python (Linux and Windows executables will be provided)

description: contagious goblins are a real threat.
A minimalist rogue-like game featuring bar graphs.
runtimeRequirements: I'll be using the SpriteKit framework, so unfortunately this'll be OS X 10.9 only.

description: Player and enemies are chess pieces, and thus can only move in directions according to their type.  Each level is a randomly generated board of various dimesions (close to 8x8) and with obstacles (i.e. spaces that are blocked so no piece can move)
runtimeRequirements: using libgdx, so can run in html5 browser, android, or desktop linux/mac/win.

description: HTML5 rogue with a Lovecraftian vibe.
A game about a self-aware robot trying to escape its robot overlords.  Will eventually feature tactical combat and extensive self-modification.
runtimeRequirements: PC, Mac, Linux.  Built on SFML

description:
This is my first attempt to make a simple roguelike, strongly inspired by nethack! :)
See the README for some details.
Developed with Emacs, Clozure Common Lisp and lispbuilder-sdl for fun.

Exploring the topic of free speech in roguelike form. Hand out pamphlets to passerbys in hope of converting them to your Cause. Run from Enemies of the Cause, who'll beat you up if you don't get to a safehouse.
An ill-advised scientific experiment has left you stranded in the far future, but some senseless violence will surely set things right.
runtimeRequirements: 64 bit Linux, OpenGL graphics card. Possibly Windows, but don't hold your breath.

description:
Asynchronous CO-OP turn-based dungeon crawling.

Playing with an ally will not break turn-based play, but players are able to help each other across identical dungeon instances.

A first person procedural platformer where you try to stage a 51% attack on the currency of the future.

(Health issues prevented me from participating in the jam, going to re-attempt the following week)
developerName: Game Builder Club and Building 3d Game Birds Gameapp Maker Co.
runtimeRequirements: Any browser that runs the Unity web plugin. Standalone Win, Mac, and Linux builds will also be available.

description: Far far away there was a land full of demons and other evil creatures. They lived their chaotic life but one day a strange tower appeared. It was really a disaster. The wave of love and happiness had spread all over the land. You're a mighty demon who want to stop this. That's why you must climb to the very last floor of the tower and kill a fairy who started this love madness.

A rogulike that consists of one giant, chaotic map. You are CLU, Kevin Flynn's program tasked with finding the scuzzy data. You task is simple - make it alive from one end of the fragmented memory canyons to the other. But watch out for the grid bugs, data pushers, and recognizers along the way!

While you were remotely piloting your R.E.E.D. in FlatlineRL you were struck by massive neural feedback causing massive body and brain trauma. You wake up an undisclosed amount of time later in the trauma centre. No-one's around and the door's locked.

TraumaRL is an action adventure roguelike utilising graph algorithms to 'intelligently' create procedural levels (and locked doors). Hopefully you won't notice...

ShroomArts drew some fantastic 1-bit graphics for the game, acting as art director and voice of reason throughout the development process.
runtimeRequirements: Windows (XP+), Linux (mono - to come). Still using libtcod.net from 2008, yay.

description:
Runic Ruins is a time attack game where the player must
find and activate runes to extend the timer and collect
more points. The rune that needs to be pressed appears
in the top right of the screen. If you get stuck go in
the direction of the glowing pillar in the central room.
runtimeRequirements: Any Computer that can run a JAR and simple graphics

description: A simple classic ascii (cp437) coffeebreak roguelike. There are three stages, a dungeon/cellar stage, a cave stage, and a throne/treasure room stage.
It's a lil' roguelike called "Lil' RPG!" Started late on March 10th.
Find Yer Treasure! will be a sort of arcade style roguelike. Its about quick plays and high scores.
You're a bird. All you can do is flap and avoid running into things.
Winter is coming, and you've been sneaking bread from Lord Randal's pantry. He's on to you this time, and now he's sent out the hounds...

There is nothing you can't achieve with the right potion!

Just try not to get addicted...
Destroy Blocks and FInd your Way

Roguelike Card RPG
for some reason it will not let me like my itch.io page where I have it uploaded, sorry for the link through

Join the resistance in their quest to overthrow the evil Bankers. Follow clues to find “Eden Sector”, the resting place of a legendary artifact. Make friends with strange aliens along the way. And finally return to your people through an active war zone. Started March 11th 2014. Finished 3/16/14.

An experimental little puzzler roguelike, where changing the colour of the background changes the layout of the dungeon. Collect as many diamonds as possible, before running out of steps, or trapping yourself in a corner.

/!\ You will die! /!\ 
The game is made for you to die and become stronger and stronger so don't give up too quick!

Online score : http://cyber-ship.louis-denizet.fr/

Controls : 
With controller (highly recommended) : 
A for Primary weapon
B for Secondary weapon
X for Bomb

Keyboard : arrows to move
A for Primary weapon
Z for Secondary weapon
Space for Bomb

About the game : Cyber Ships is a double jam attempt. 
We made it with my girlfriend who did the graphics and myself, both amateur.

As we don't have much time this month, we wanted to make a game for cyberpunk game jam and roguelike challenge both at the same time.
You will be able to build your ships depending of the tactic you make for your run and optimise your ship in many ways depending of your game style. 

There is 3 levels with mini boss and a final boss.

This is our first game of that kind and we hope you'll have much fun playing it. 
We did it in around 5 days and we tried our best to balance the game. 

Thanks A LOT to Shio-Z for being really nice allowing us to use their song in the game.
Starry Night, song by SHIO-Z composed by
Patrick Rizzi (www.facebook.com/Shiozed)
runtimeRequirements: Controller is highly recommended.You will also need to understand how the game works to build your ship depending of your tactics.Old computers may have low frame rate.

description: An untitled roguelike that involves ghosts!
The player needs to survive traps that move in real-time.

Drawgeon is a(n attempt to make a) card game RL.
Every dungeon is a pile of cards (ending with a boss fight) and each draw leads to an event, fight or not.

Zombie is a real-time tactics game played on a procedural battlefield with a day/night cycle. The field consists of two to three stages separated by rivers populated with progressively dangerous human opponents. The object of the game is for the player to guide the zombie horde and attempt to wipe out (turn into zombies) a majority of the humans.

Meteorite fragments can be collected by the horde to increase their speed and strength (resistance to damage). Bonuses add up but there aren't enough meteorites to max both speed and strength.

Rivers can be crossed by zombies at any point but they can't swim and will be swept down stream. Seek out shallow crossings for the most control when fording rivers.

At night, humans are at a disadvantage with limited visibility. During the day, humans actively hunt zombies and have much greater range and accuracy. Zombies can seek shelter in dense forests to make it more difficult for humans to detect and shoot them. Zombies are very vulnerable in the day time. Watch the clock carefully and avoid open spaces.

The game has been tested in Chrome and Firefox.
runtimeRequirements: A modern web browser that supports HTML5 and JavaScript. Tested in Chrome and Firefox.

description:
Cyber Phreak is a experimental control rogue-like. Whistle to match the tones in the environment to open doors, freeze enemies, and unlock data for points.

WASD to move, mouse to look around. Look at an object and whistle to interact. Approach an object to hear it's frequency, match it's frequency with a whistle to interact (currently frequency matching is not perfect whistle a tone a bit below the tone you hear).

Whistle at doors to open them.
Whistle at the yellow data blocks to release data bits for points.
Whistle at the white security daemons to freeze them for 5 seconds, if they touch you, you die!
Thanks for playing!

description: As a young adventurer, you hear rumours about strange creatures around a nearby cave. Your interest piqued, you set out to explore the dangers in this cave. You dart in a nearby alcove for cover, and through the obscuring dust you see the last glimpses of sunlight as your only exit is sealed shut by the falling rubble. Now you need to find an another way out or perish, but the path before you only delves deeper into the abyss.

The game appears to be an audio synthesizer. The game itself is confined to an 8x8 board. The object is to kill every mob on the level then advance to the next. The twist is really that damage is defined for player and mobs by a "wave": a visible oscillating wave such that the damage you will do is clear. Items on the board are "patches" and will alter the wave of either player or mob depending on who picks it up.This game uses terminology and concepts from the world of audio synthesis. Given that for gameplay purposes the concepts have been changed around a bit and nothing really works like on an actual synthesizer, I expect synth fans to either be charmed by or hate the game; non synth fans I expect will probably be bemused or confused by it.

Fast-paced tactical combat focused on Ability and Time management. Cool-down timers regulate ability usage by both the player and the enemies.

Game features:
 * Unique, ability-based, fast-paced tactical combat.
 * “Asynchronous” turn-based play. Each action requires a different amount of time, both for the player and for enemies.
 * Two ways to clear a level: eliminate all enemies, or visit all checkpoints.
 * Time pressure from the “red alert” countdown clock. When it expires, all enemies will be alerted to your position, and killed enemies will start rising from the dead!
 * 25 enemy types, all of which have different AI, attacks, speed, and sensory abilities.
 * 10 active abilities and 3 passive abilities that help you progress through the game.
 * When the player takes damage, a random ability is lost for the remainder of the level. Abilities are restored and a randomly selected new ability is granted when levels 1, 3, 5, and 7 are completed.

Edit: I fixed two major bugs that would cause the game to crash. These fixes came after the deadline, but I'll hope you forgive me. I'd rather that people can play the game without it crashing, even if it technically means I made changes to the game after the time limit expired.

A roguelike very loosely based on the Warhammer 40k game Space Hulk. You start in the middle of a large group of derelict spaceships and have to make your way to the outside of the hulk. A space shuttle waits there to take you to freedom.
Survive on a red planet by gathering resources, resupplying oxygen and killing hostile animals.

An entirely deterministic arena fighting roguelike where you use chess-like moves to move around and attack enemies.

The thing is, your heart is located in a tomb below the necromancer's tower, and the necromancer doesn't really want to let you go.

Pos-failre description update: a glorified Field of View / Line of Sight "tech demo". Hopes of having the actual game done by March 21st

In the tower where the most powerful incantations are kept, learned, and invoked. Old magic stirs to life. Awakened, long forgotten secrets are reclaimed.

2D traversal of 3D cube faces. Lets just keep it simple this time and see if I can make something.

1D dungeons, some other axis you can move on (time travel, eversion-style shifting, etc)
Realtime graphical assassination roguelike. Use special abilities to avoid guards in procedurally-generated levels, get to your target, and escape.

description: Twitter Bot for the #7DRL challenge.
Figuring it out!

You find yourself in a cave filled with enemies. There's no point in staying here! 
Grab your weapon and head down to kill as enemies many as you can before your inevitable demise!
Collect keys and reach the stairs to go down another floor.

Features:
- Fight off hordes of enemies! Each enemy has it's own combat abilities.
- Use a variety of weapons and items to lay waste to those who oppose you!
- Railgun trails, bullets and rockets flying through the air, explosions, gore! All kinds of visual effects for extra visceral combat.
- Randomly generated caves, items and horde spawns, keep on your toes!
- Who doesn't like boomsticks and chain explosions?
An @ traverses a two-dimensional grid, slashing enemies and avoiding the Pong of Death.

A game I've already been toying around with in my head for a few weeks, this seems like a great opportunity to test my ideas! Control a group of adventurers delving in to a variety of locales to find ancient and useful artifacts. Hoping to end up with something light on combat and heavy on decision making, but we'll see what happens!
Turn-based platformer roguelike with sneaking and thievery, made in Purescript.
Descend into the tunnels of Dry Hills in search of a great evil.

Something about nasty, dumb monsters scratching their butts with playing cards.

description: You must enter the dungeon, where ghosts are rumored to roam. Some say the ghosts are easy to defeat. Others say they are nearly impossible. You be the judge.
Cleanup the house for a week or you can't go to the fair! Each day, you need to cleanup after yourself and finish your chores before your parents get home. All while having fun too.

simple random adventure

You are an apothecary sent on a quest by your king. Recover a rare truffle out of an infested cavern. Your king loans you his royal truffle pig to help you on your adventure. Returning without the fungus or with a dead pig is not ideal.

Gameplay features: Enemies are non hostile to you but the pig likes to pick fights, collect ingredients to create a wide variety of potions with differing qualities and effects, buff your pig with crazy abilities from your potions, and most importantly retrieve the truffle.

Ganondorf opened a dance club on the moon. Link wants treasure. The moon dungeon is really big.

**This is the same game as Cloak & Tower!**
N/A

I've always wanted to do 7DRL but I'm an artist not a programmer and didn't have anyone to work with, so my plan is to make a board/card game based roguelike that people can print out and play. My plan is to incorporate common RL mechanics like perma-death, dungeon crawling, and random generation but in a board game setting with multiple players.
runtimeRequirements: A printer and pair of scissors.

description:
Designed to be a learning experience, hopefully will end up with some semblance of a game.

Overall idea:
You are a trader wandering through the wilderness, each square takes a different amount of time to move through (mountains vs trees vs plains) and you must avoid threats and get from city A to city B in a timely fashion.

End Result:
I am happy with the results. I learned a ton doing this project, and came out with a relatively fun little game. Enjoy!

It is the sequel of a game I will never make.
I'll write the full description later.
A game about the most brutal, bloody and tactical activity known to humankind: the politics! Crush your opponents and lead your party to the ultimate victory... That is, win the election...

description: Pain is the true enemy. Defeat it, and live.

You are the wizard Hexxus, your spells are powered by the life force of the surrounding terrain.  
But your new neighbors are not very welcoming, in fact they seem downright hostile.

Basically you ability to cast spells proportional to the amount of plant growth immediately surrounding you, adding a new tactical and strategic layer to the game and externalizing a normally internal mana pool.

A game about the relationship between man and woman, an individual and society, mankind and the universe.

http://doubledashgames.com/HurtYoghurt/HurtYoghurtWeb.html

Inspired by Bolg-Phuru (a friend IRL, that tried Hebrac in 2013 7DRL), I want to restart this project! This game is inspired by the homonymous card game: you are an adventurer in a dungeon, owned by Hebrac, a powerful magician.
Squad based roguelike. You guide your team of bad ass marines in missions on a jungle planet fighting dangerous bugs and completing mission goals.

Barebones FPS roguelike, made to teach myself how to use Unreal Engine. Spent most of the time doing tutorials, as predicted, but i did end up with something playable. The dungeons are randomly generated, with a couple of enemy types. Windows only, sorry, couldn't get the HTML5 build to work.
It technically met my goals, but it's not really worth reviewing so i tagged it as failed.

Windows console app built using C# that allows a bunch of traditional adventurers (Fighter, Mage, Ranger, Cleric and Thief battle against other teams for the grand old game of dungeon rugby. Few rules, get the ball and put in in the goal (guarded by the opposition). Not may more rules that that!!!

Unknown blazing sun rises, heating up pale dust under your feet and wreckage of ship behind you.
Crashed at this hot and dry planet because of asteroid impact, you need to escape from this hell.
Or at least survive.
What are you suppose to do to protect your village from winter threats?

Save the villagers from a corrupting evil. Farm, hunt, and gather food to keep them (and you) fed. You win when the evil is defeated, and lose when everyone starves to death. Probably not at all balanced, but it works anyway.
Reach the bottom of the pac-man like dungeons to find the Amulet of Yendor. Features semi-turnbased movement, items, shops and highscore.

Okay, so I recently started tooling around with Libtcod and was looking for a nice way to tighten up some of my coding skills (also I'm a big fan of cyberpunk, hence the project name). I figured I'd throw all those elements into a big pot and see what comes of it.

I'm starting later than I would have liked as I only found out about the 7DRL challenge yesterday, but it's a genre I've loved for a long time. It'll be more like a 120 something hour RL by the time I've finished.

Features I'd like to include:

* Cool cyberpunk gear, possibly with words like 'flechette' in the name.

* Body augmentation.

* Stealth (although it might be pushing it a bit far).

* Hacking.

*Maybe some simple mission generation type stuff using Markov Chains.

*Hopefully drenched in a lurid neon colour-scheme.

Wish me luck.
Highly-polished Graphical Puzzle RL with many simple features and strategic choice. Based on the concept of "Primordial Soup".
Simple tile based dungeon crawler from first-person view using 2d spirits.

He had to rescue her before her death, but the only way to do it was fighting against the worst monsters that lived behind the portal.  So he and other two fathers went fighting in this tournament, but only one could come back alive from this journey. "
A tiny sized window game where the character automatically progresses through the dungeon.

description:
You, the Devil have dug a tunnel to the entrance of heaven.Now its time to find and kill the key-holder.
Kill them with Fire !!!
(Real Time Game play.
Randomly generated level each play through. 
Random Boss behavior in each play through. 
Random starting Stats. Random change in Stats from the drops. Mini-map Integration. 
2D Sprites used for Graphics.
Made in Unity.)

description: For years, the Yendori people were a legend. Explorers have recently found a cave in the purported Yendori borders whose bottom is filled with water: Already divers are bringing back relics that scientists have dated to when the Yendori may have lived. You've just arrived at the impromptu dive lodge assembled near the cave waters. Will you make your riches from the cave? Or will you join the Yendori people in the Anoxic Depths?
runtimeRequirements: Tested on OS X and Windows (Unity 3D)

description:
Rodney wakes up surrounded by strange creatures.
They look at him like he is tasty morcel.
Escape the creatures and find a way out of this weird dimention.

Your goal is to reach your penthouse at the top of Glass Tower, an expensive hotel, and close the ancient magical tome you opened. The elevators are busted, and there is an army of possessed glass sculptures in your way.
A kestrel simulator with froguelike elements.

Sounds boring?  Well, that's what makes it a challenge!

Born at the bottom of a dungeon, you are as much a monster as anyone. And yet, you have ambitions far greater than any of your brethren. So steal their powers, climb to the surface and rule the world!
The lobsterfolk have stolen the Jewel of Zot.  Get it back using powers from a fickle god. My first game. Not too far from the classic roguelike formula.
