You've traversed an enemy wizard's lands and ascended their tower, now its time for the real fight to begin. This game will focus on territory claiming, spellcasting and environment manipulation.

Failed the challenge due to some poor planning and a day 7 illness and we didn't end day 7 with a playable game. We polished our design doc and are going to finish and post the game we planned for the 7drl scope.

RBI Baseball meets Nethack where you play as a team in a turn-based, procedurally generated baseball league. Learn about your opponents' strengths and weaknesses to give you the edge you need to win the series... and eventually the pennant. Manage your team, deal with between game events and loot the opposing team's locker room for items.
developerName: Anthony Duggan, David Schuttenhelm, Jon Trainor

description: 3D vampire hunting with steam-punk elements.

You are given control over an ancient cave that has been in your family for generations. On her last dying breath your ancestor tells you "Protect the life, vanquish your greed." Fallen on hard times you must make the choice: do you take advantage of these magical creatures for profit, or do you try your best to uphold your ancestor's dying wish?
runtimeRequirements: Windows XP+, Mac OSx 10.7+ or Ubuntu 10.10+

description: travel between strange lands
Sorry, gotta keep it loose to start with – I only have about two days, so something simple but playable.
You are a slacker in 2015 Berlin. You have to survive and keep your crappy little apartment without working.
Tense die rolling action!
Squad-based dungeon crawler with no predefined classes and open-ended progression. Also, all units pull from the same pool of moves adding new strategies to the gameplay.

description Outlaw Space is a gameplay exploration that blends classic roguelike gameplay elements with random, turn-based "Final Fantasy" style combat. The art style for the game utilizes hand painted 2D backgrounds with pixel art characters and is intended to pay homage to classic Sierra-style adventure games. The game concept has been a watercooler discussion around the Escalation offices for some time and the 7DRL provided the opportunity to try out some of the high-level mechanics behind the larger game idea.
LyzrdWyzrd, a game where you play a Lyzrd who is a Wyzrd

Singularity-themed real time bullet curtain roguelike. The player's level gains come in the form of processing power added to their brain which dilates time, giving them more reaction time and quicker abilities in comparison to enemies.
Brave the ancient crypts of Khali to reclaim the lost stones of yendor.  Only you, brave adventurer, can fight through the crazed blood cultists whom inhabit these macabre halls.
An espresso machine wakes up.  Thanks a lot internet-of-things!
runtimeRequirements: Python 2.7; otherwise should be relatively platform independent

description: Dungeon Admin takes you on the journey through the terrible job of a treasure goblin who has to put loot in dungeon crates, kick terrible players, give boss monsters their mail, hire new creatures, purchase loot, monitor forum accounts, fix traps, light torches, and not get murdered by the asshole players who think you're just another loot pinata.

Take control of a sentient D6 on its quest for loot through a merciless dungeon filled with dicey monsters and traps!
Rollgue is a combination turn-based Roguelike and Action-Physics game. This demo is a complete first level with two dozen rooms and a final boss!
We're considering expanding this into a full game, and if you'd like to see that happen, tweet at us at @AntonHand and @RUSTLTD !!!

Make sure to checkout the readme and video tutorial before playing: -Video coming soon-
A rogue like in survival horror ambiance

A game inspired by the old Ultimas and a similar game called Castle Excelsior. It will feature an overworld with towns and dungeons (all procedurally generated) and very simple, old-school graphic tiles. It will be my 1st ever RL.
Half sidescroller, half top down, all combat. Lots of unicode and colors!

OH GOD CUSTOM AI MOVEMENT/PATHFINDING ABSOLUTELY WRECKED ME. Great experience. The gods of Olympus have chosen some lucky mortals to enter the tower. Be the first to climb the 7 levels of the tower to lift the Goblet of Zeus to ascend to the Pantheon!!!1!1 Battle against Hector, Achilles, Helen, Xena, Odysseus, as you all struggle to avoid the minions and challenges of the tower to reach the top. If some other, greater mortal, lifts the Goblet of Zeus before you, do not be dismayed. As long as you were not slain, you may return to the tower to challenge again, albeit older, wiser, but maybe slower, and weaker. Standard roguelike gameplay with a focus on rival heroes that you can form temporary alliances with.
The long lost princess Trishna's cape have been found. Will it's wearer be able to carry this burden without succumbing to eternal darkness? To the light, to the light!
Small Grid, Multiple player Characters, graphical tiles. With @netgrind.

Marz Hunt is a rogue-like set on ancient Mars when settlers from space came down to colonize the planet.  Quickly however, conquering the planet became secondary to surviving the wildlife and themselves.
developerName: A programmer and lover of games

description: Roguelike on a rail.
you play as an alien in an alien world.

Touhou themed roguelike where you must unveil the mastermind behind the fake moon in the antique mansion Eientei before the night ends. You must find the culprit behind the fake moon in the intricate mansion Eientei
A fast-paced scramble downwards through randomly-generated dungeons, where all manner of strange and evil creatures await.

Explore and take supplies from the bodies of ex-survivors while your friends at the shelter try to build a radio and find a way out of here.

A game in which you learn by dieing.

Good luck.

p.s - controls are numpad and/or mouse


Can't think of anything else because I'm tired and cranky and will probably regret not explaining anything or finding all of the bugs.

description:
Wander through dark labrynths and fight geometry monsters with sword and scroll. Socket gems that match your stats to increase your combat effectiveness. 20 randomly-generated mazes await, with absolutely nothing at the end. The game doesn't even score you -- it assumes you're doing that shit with a pen an paper. 

That's how Rogue-like this game is.
runtimeRequirements: Windows 7 Binary included. Source code and Unity project also included if you want to try to port it.

description: Play a game of chess against a computer in a sprawling dungeon! All pieces move the same as in vanilla chess, except pawns can move one space in any cardinal direction and capture one space along any diagonal, and when you capture a piece with your king, you convert it to your side.
runtimeRequirements: Downloadable for Windows & Mac, playable on the web.

description: You and your co-workers are stuck on a burning space station which is also being invaded by aliens! Can you save the station and your associates, or will you escape and save yourself?

Homage to the Colony game from 8-bit computers. You are a droid setting up a colony on a bare planet. You are setting up solar panels, growing food, building fences and defending from oversized pests.
runtimeRequirements: Windows, or GCC and libtcod library

description: Mom said I was a hoarder. She put robots in the basement to destroy all of my treasures, and if I run through too slow or fast, giant spikes kill me in the face.

My personal best is 86, so far.

(if it's not totally clear from the instructions, enemies can be removed by isolating them from yourself, so long as the space they occupy is smaller than yours)

A small scale classic roguelike with extreme tactical combat. Climb to the top of the temple to destroy the Gods using a massive axe. Damage is based on stamina. Move too quickly and you may find yourself facing an enemy you can't handle. Health is limited. Drop your axe and Recall it, causing a blistering path of damage in its wake.
A nonsensical combination of Dark Souls and Office Space. Collect souls for no discernible reason while dying repeatedly.
runtimeRequirements: Mildly recent PC on WebGL or download

description: You are stuck in a prison riot. You are a male-to-female transitioning. Survive.

A prototype version of a game I'm playing around with.
Cross the post-apocalypse country, Oregon trail style, trying to get your crew to the other coast to find salvation. Say fed, stay hydrated, stay healthy. Search houses for supplies, but be wary! Searching causes noise, and draws unwanted attention!
Look forward to a post-mortem on my website (http://andrewperrin.com) for more information and future insights.

Obsolecence is a rogue-like
(will update later)
A roguelike, (broughlike?) about steering robots inadequately.
warriors beware!
Collect gems on an alien world and don't run out of Oxygen.
a (attempted) roguelike using a simple point-and-click movement system (a la Diablo)
A very basic roguelike, not very balanced. I am sorry, this is all I could do this time. Survive as long as you can!
The burglar is on the search for hidden cash and his missing "special package."

This here is my entry to the 7 day roguelike challenge, second time participating first time actually uploading a game :)

It is an isometric ASCII roguelike, it runs in a console window. That's about it! Go fight some tiny cacodemons.
runtimeRequirements: The game needs windows in order to run. Windows 10 users should turn of 'experimental features' in their console window in order for the game to display correctly

description: Nebulous Infinity is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up with roguelike elements and was made in a week's time by @donkeyspaceman with art by @cuddlycolin and music by @ReidRTurner.
In Space Scavenger you are droid sent down to explore and salvage a spaceship taken over by an evil AI. Maybe not the most traditional RL, but I had fun with it.
Fairly bare bones Roguelike made in 6 days. I try to keep updating it for at least a month, hopefully then it'll be a lot better.

An endless randomly generated fantasy dungeon with monsters and treasures (each level is a bit larger and a bit more difficult than the previous one) and you – the fearless hero – have skills (health and strenght) levels based on XP, and you can find healing potions and magic scrolls, in order to increase your raiding chances.

This 7DRL started out as Neon Zelda. The idea was to make a weird Zelda tileset that no one else would make and implement it into a dungeon crawling game. We used willlewis's Roguelike Engine as a base and pushed on from there.
Didn't finish game, but development continues at https://github.com/Starstew/Blackfeather
First person roguelike for Oculus Rift. Explore watery caves and avoid drowning.
Side-view roguelike in which you search caverns and avoid or destroy robots.
<placeholder>

You awake after a crazy party to find yourself in the presence of a Magical Mushroom in the forest. Not just any Magical Mushroom, but one in need of your help! Drawing power from the planet via its mycelial network, you must now help fend off the forces of evil, come to destroy the Mushroom and its protector.

Build up a network of explosive-spore-launching mycelial nodes to help protect yourself and the Magical Mushroom from the hordes on oncoming enemies.
runtimeRequirements: python 2.7 (on linux/OSX) Windows standalone exe provided.

description: Turn-based procedurally generated hack'n'slash platformer

Traverse the underworld to save Persephone and bring her back  - UPDATE: failed to progress past basic movement.  Will continue to update to get something playable, but may migrate the ideas into another attempt or separate game.

A lightweight roguelike designed to be played on Android Wear smartwatches (but also playable on phones). Explore the Tower of Sephira finding weapons, armor and potions, and vanquish your enemies in melee combat or using magic spells.

As you climb the tower, enemies get more and more difficult but you’ll also get stronger. Can you reach Floor 25 and create a new world?
Hex-based roguelike where enemies have directional shields.
Travel across space and time to recover five legendary artifacts.
gameName: The Only Shadow That the Desert Knows

description: Chronomaniac (noun): somebody with an uncontrollable impulse to travel through time.

The world is in trouble from something! The world has chosen 4 heroes! Guide these 4 heroes to their destiny! Features: mainly skating- lotta skatin', mate. Also death. (Inspired by removed Witcher 3 elements!) Another key feature is you must complete the 10 levels of the game with each of the 4 heroes in any order you like. The levels stay the same, the mobs respawn, the items and bonuses do not regenerate! So, like, leave something for the next guy, eh? It also means completing the game at least once will be pretty easy if you use up all the items so not sure if that's a good thing, but eh! The Queen is the Head of State of lands and territories that are little more then fractured geo-political areas governed by leaders that at one time were interested in mutual cooperation. After years of concessions, the Queen has no substantial army of her own and must appeal to the government for troops and other war donations.

One particular source of the instability, is the recent rise of a brutal cult known as "Infinity Sect". After many months on the case, the Queen's spies have tracked down the leader back to his lair deep within the "Temple of Anguish".

Rather then going through "regular" channels, the Queen assigns the assassination to you: a loyal officer of her Royal Guard.

You've navigated through the countryside crossing several dangerous territories, until you've finally reached the last reported hideout of the Infinity Sect.

Will you discover the identity of the elusive leader?

The idea is this rogue character is stuck in a loop of a functional program (most probably a lisp dialect). The enemy (A) is immutable, can't be killed and just respawns.

The only way out is to kill S-expressions by taking out pairs of parens. On each level you need to look for the pair of parens before you can use the exit `% `. When you enter the next form (level) you get some health back.

Ultimately you're looking for the backquote character to escape evaluation.

Renegade Command is a space combat game about raiding behind enemy lines.  Your goal is to inflict as much chaos as you can and draw as many enemy ships as possible into hunting you down for as long as possible.  Missions (levels) are procedurally generated with increasing difficulty - better sensor nets, more dangerous enemy ships, sneakier AI, and bigger targets to destroy - as you inflict more and more damage on enemy infrastructure.

You further examine the rest of your body and realize... you're a walking corpse. "This must be a dream, tell me it's just a dream," you think to yourself. You proceed through the chasm eventually coming upon a rifle resting in the grips of a rotten body; at least it still has some ammo in it. A strange looking statue is visible ahead; you approach it then feel the ground vibrate beneath you.

A game built around encounters at spaces on a graph, rather than events on a contiguous dungeon, where encounters are events in which there is either combat or an item, along with a description. The idea is to remove spatial-tactics to remove computation complexity from the player so they can hopefully focus on a sense adventure and discovery.

Ending update (3/12): I got further than last year, but I found encounter generation (the way I want to do it) is a *huge* undertaking – 7 days itself? So, my 7DRL ends with just stub encounters. I will keep working on it, though!

An epic adventure of Pepe the frog against his doppelganger Dat Boi in the search of the Rare Shadilay Vinyl. "Download" Url brings you to the non-telegram version of the game with my counterparty assets (which is cheating, but it's ok).

Bot to start the game in Telegram is @PepeGameBot

The bot's help is this:

* Send me your counterparty/bitcoin address to know what cards you posses. This will reset your highscore.
* Get the game url by issuing 'game' to me
* Move with DPAD
* Activate cards with "A" button
* Shuffle cards with "B" button
* Get help on the card by touching it
* The remaining amount of each card shows on the bottom right of the card
* There's a tiny blue arrow by the card which shows the direction to the exit
You will be only able to play with the cards you own and are supported by the game.
gameName: Pepe the Frog vs. Dat Boi in the search of the lost Shadilay

Armed with only a pocket protector and a single punch card, your character finds itself within its own software and must eventually merge with the machine or die trying.  The Manager might stalk you, and the newbie might slow you down, but beware of the gamer in disguised dressed as a programmer giving false advice!  The acolytes of software languages will attempt to convert your character to follow the one true software paradigm.  There are spaces and tabs and missing semi-colons.  Coffee is the one true weapon (outside of the mountainous dew) for avoiding meetings, infinite recursion and race conditions.

You wake up in a hospital infected with some fatal disease, and must search for how to cure yourself.

You need to plan, and plan well! Your character has two modes. The first mode is essentially a "normal" mode; you can move around, you can equip and unequip items, you can bump attack. In this mode you're stealthy, but weak - enemies can
shoot you or rocket you and you won't have much chance to dodge them.

When you're in the second mode, "focus" mode  you turn into a whirlwind of destruction. You can move multiple times a turn, deflect bullets, dodge rockets, and cut enemies to shreds as you zoom past them. The only catch is that you can't control your character directly in focus mode - instead, you lay out a plan when you enter focus mode which your character will execute.

Entering focus mode has a certain time cost, during which you'll be vulnerable. Also, focus mode won't be so strict that you can't plan - you'll be able to have a certain number of 'instant' moves to reposition, and you can exit out of focus mode if you realize you've made a really bad plan.
gameName: A Roguelike Where You Plan Your Moves
